lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* The Duke class is the main entry point for the Duke chatbot
* It is responsible for initializing the UI, Storage and TaskList objects,
* and running the chatbot loop until an exit command is given
* Constructs a new Duke object with the specified file path for storage.
* @param filePath the file path for storage
* Runs the Duke chatbot loop until an exit command is given.
* The main method that creates a new Duke object and starts the chatbot.
* Command class represents the commands issued by the user.
* An enumeration of possible command types.
BYE, LIST, MARK, DELETE, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, UNMARK, FIND, HELP, DUE
* Constructs a new Command object with the given command type, end time
* @param endTime the end time of task
* Constructs a new Command object with the given command type, description, start time, and end time.

public Command(CommandType command, String description, LocalDateTime startTime) {

* Returns true if the command is of type BYE, indicating that the program should exit.
* @return true if the command is of type BYE, false otherwise
* Executes the command on the given task list, UI, and storage objects.
* @param tasks  TaskList object to execute the command on
* @param ui ui the UI object to interact with the user
* @throws DukeException if any errors occur during the execution of the command
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
Task eventTask = new Event(description, startTime, endTime);

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done duke.task with X

* Returns the type of the task.
* Return the start time of task

* It provides methods for displaying messages to the user and reading user input.

+ "\t What can I do for you? ().:\n"

* The Parser class is responsible for parsing the user input and creating the appropriate Command object to be executed by Duke.
* The parse method takes in a String of user input and uses a switch statement to determine the type of Command to create based on the command keyword.
* If the input String is not recognized as a valid command, a DukeException is thrown with an error message.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! You need to specify which task to mark as done.");
throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! Index must be a integer number.");

throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! Index must be a integer number.");
throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! You need to specify which task to delete.");

throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
return new Command(Command.CommandType.DEADLINE, deadlineDescription, LocalDateTime.parse(deadlineTime, formatter));
throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! The description and time of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! The time of a deadline must be in the format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm.");
return new Command(Command.CommandType.EVENT, eventDescription, LocalDateTime.parse(eventStartTime, formatter), LocalDateTime.parse(eventEndTime, formatter));
throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! The description, start time and end time of an event cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! The time of a event must be in the format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm.");
throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! You need to specify the keyword.");
throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! You need to specify the date.");
throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! The time must be in the format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm.");
throw new DukeException("\t  OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(" + "\n\t You can entre keyword 'help' for more details!");
